content:
XPathItem Class

In this Article

Represents an item in the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class XPathItem

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • XPathItem

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

An item is either a node or an atomic value.

Constructors summary

XPathItem()

Initializes a new instance of the XPathItem class.

Properties summary

IsNode

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the item represents an XPath node or an atomic value.
TypedValue

When overridden in a derived class, gets the current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate .NET Framework 2.0 type according to its schema type.
Value

When overridden in a derived class, gets the string value of the item.
ValueAsBoolean

When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a Boolean.
ValueAsDateTime

When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a DateTime.
ValueAsDouble

When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a Double.
ValueAsInt

When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an Int32.
ValueAsLong

When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an Int64.
ValueType

When overridden in a derived class, gets the .NET Framework 2.0 type of the item.
XmlType

When overridden in a derived class, gets the XmlSchemaType for the item.

Methods summary

ValueAs(Type)

Returns the item's value as the specified type.
ValueAs(Type,IXmlNamespaceResolver)

When overridden in a derived class, returns the item's value as the type specified using the IXmlNamespaceResolver object specified to resolve namespace prefixes.

Constructors

  • XPathItem()

    Initializes a new instance of the XPathItem class.

    protected XPathItem ();

    Remarks

    This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.

Properties

  • IsNode

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the item represents an XPath node or an atomic value.

    public abstract bool IsNode { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the item represents an XPath node; false if the item represents an atomic value.

  • TypedValue

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate .NET Framework 2.0 type according to its schema type.

    public abstract object TypedValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate .NET Framework type.

    Remarks

    If the value of the item is not valid according to its specified schema type, the value of the TypedValue property is equivalent to the value of the Value property.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • Value

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the string value of the item.

    public abstract string Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string value of the item.

  • ValueAsBoolean

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a Boolean.

    public abstract bool ValueAsBoolean { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      The item's value as a Boolean.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the Boolean type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast to Boolean is not valid.

    Remarks

    The ValueAsDateTime property attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 Boolean type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • ValueAsDateTime

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a DateTime.

    public abstract DateTime ValueAsDateTime { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The item's value as a DateTime.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the DateTime type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast to DateTime is not valid.

    Remarks

    The ValueAsDateTime property attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 DateTime type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • ValueAsDouble

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a Double.

    public abstract double ValueAsDouble { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The item's value as a Double.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the Double type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast to Double is not valid.

    • OverflowException

      The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.

    Remarks

    The ValueAsDouble property attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 Double type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • ValueAsInt

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an Int32.

    public abstract int ValueAsInt { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The item's value as an Int32.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the Int32 type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast to Int32 is not valid.

    • OverflowException

      The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.

    Remarks

    The ValueAsInt property attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 Int32 type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • ValueAsLong

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as an Int64.

    public abstract long ValueAsLong { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int64

      The item's value as an Int64.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the Int64 type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast to Int64 is not valid.

    • OverflowException

      The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.

    Remarks

    The ValueAsLong property attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 Int64 type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • ValueType

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the .NET Framework 2.0 type of the item.

    public abstract Type ValueType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The .NET Framework type of the item. The default value is String.

    Remarks

    When overridden in a derived class, the ValueType property gets the .NET Framework type of the typed value of the item.

    For example, an element of type xs:int would have a ValueType of Int32 by default. However, the ValueType could be any one of the valid types that can be mapped to xs:int, such as Int16 or Double.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.

  • XmlType

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the XmlSchemaType for the item.

    public abstract System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType XmlType { get; }

    Property Value

    • XmlSchemaType

      The XmlSchemaType for the item.

    Remarks

    When overridden in a derived class, the XmlType property gets the XmlSchemaType for the item. For example, the XmlSchemaSimpleType or XmlSchemaComplexType.

Methods

  • ValueAs(Type)

    Returns the item's value as the specified type.

    public virtual object ValueAs (Type returnType);

    Parameters

    • returnType
      Type

      The type to return the item value as.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The value of the item as the type requested.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast is not valid.

    • OverflowException

      The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.

    Remarks

    When overridden in a derived class, the ValueAs method attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 type specified.

  • ValueAs(Type,IXmlNamespaceResolver)

    When overridden in a derived class, returns the item's value as the type specified using the IXmlNamespaceResolver object specified to resolve namespace prefixes.

    public abstract object ValueAs (Type returnType, System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver nsResolver);

    Parameters

    • returnType
      Type

      The type to return the item's value as.

    • nsResolver
      IXmlNamespaceResolver

      The IXmlNamespaceResolver object used to resolve namespace prefixes.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      The value of the item as the type requested.

    Exceptions

    • FormatException

      The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.

    • InvalidCastException

      The attempted cast is not valid.

    • OverflowException

      The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.

    Remarks

    When overridden in a derived class, the ValueAs method attempts to convert the value of the item to the .NET Framework 2.0 type specified.

    The IXmlNamespaceResolver object is used to resolve namespace prefixes related to type conversions. For example, when converting an xs:QName to an xs:string.

    For more information about type support in the System.Xml namespace, see Type Support in the System.Xml Classes.
